M. Butterfly

Arriving to see <em>M. Butterfly</em>, I was glad I already had a ticket reserved: waiting at the doors was the largest audience I'd seen for a Drama Barn production in months

Anish Kapoor at the Royal Academy: A conversation with Dr Adrian Locke

A wax canon, a pregnant wall, and several funfair mirrors are among the assortment of treats currently being shown at the Royal Academy of Art. But the exhibition is just a taster of the celebrated career of contemporary sculptor Anish Kapoor (Thumbnail credit Anish Kapoor - 'Greyman Cries, Shaman Dies, Billowing Smoke, Beauty Evoked', 2008-9 installed at the Royal Academy of Arts, London, Collection of the artist, Photo: John Bodkin)

<em>Place Making</em>, on display at the Norman Rea Gallery, is a bold yet engaging exhibition of sculpture, prints and paintings by David Fitzpatrick (Thumbnail credit David Fitzpatrick - Pocket)

Photocredit: Tate Photography)
